meanings.definition: In a manner intended to persuade or manipulate someone gently or gradually.
meanings.sent1: She smiled coaxingly at her little sister to share the toy.
meanings.sent2: He spoke coaxingly to the scared puppy to calm it down.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed coaxingly at its owner for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeked out coaxingly from behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the math problem coaxingly to the confused student.

meanings.definition: Using flattery or charm to convince someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He coaxingly complimented his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She coaxingly persuaded her friend to lend her the dress.
meanings.sent3: The salesman smiled coaxingly at the customer to make a sale.
meanings.sent4: The politician spoke coaxingly to win over the undecided voters.
meanings.sent5: The child hugged her mom coaxingly to get a cookie.
